sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>leader</radical> of the <radical>yakuza</radical> shows you his <radical>knife</radical>. He says, "This is an <kanji>example</kanji> of a knife."
meaningInfo: The leader of the yakuza is just showing you an example of a knife. Maybe to scare you? Why would an example of what a knife is scare you, though? Coming from the leader of the yakuza, this is a weird tactic.
readingMnemonic: "This is an <kanji>example</kanji>," the leader of the yakuza tells you. Next time, I'll show you an example of a <reading>ray</reading> (<ja>れい</ja>) gun.
readingInfo: Why is the leader of the yakuza showing you examples of weapons, not to mention weapons that aren't real, like ray guns?
